name: Antik Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights and found Antik to be well located, clean and comfortable. The rooftop restaurant was a lovely bonus with a great view of the city. Staff were polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: The hotel is close to the Grand Bazaar,restaurants and other places of interest.At front office all the staff was good but Umit karahan was really cooperative and courteous.I think he as an asset of this hotel.The hotel is newly furnished,the food is excellent and ample at breakfast.The view from the top floor restaurant is very good.I stayed there for six nights,I stayed there with my family(5 people).I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have spent two nights at the Antik and can thoroughly recommend it. It is in a good location - one street behind a main road which has the Grand Bazaar and a very efficient tram line which takes you down to most of the big sights. The staff has been terrific and their helpfulness and attention to detail cannot be faulted. We contacted the front office manager who was particularly helpful in arranging an airport pickup and a non smoking room. On our arrival and during our stay the front desk has been courteous and very helpful.
reviews.title: A great little hotel in the old quarter

reviews.text: Our room (116) is a bit small as is the case in most hotels here and the bathroom is definitely only big enough for one person at a time so if you are staying for a few days it may be best to go for a larger room. Breakfast is served in the roof cafe and is substantial and very interesting although not your classic American bacon and eggs affair. Similarly there is a happy hour up there in the late afternoon where local beers and wines are half price - quite a nice way to finish the day with a cold drink and a view over the sea. The only down side I can think of with this hotel was that the air conditioning in the room did struggle a bit. Otherwise I would definitely say that the Antik makes a very pleasant base from which to explore Istanbul
reviews.title: Antik Hotel is a Good Choice in the Old City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Antik Hotel through an Istanbul Travel Professional for an Alumnae group that I was co-leading in Turkey in May, 2012. This was a good choice. The Antik is just off the busy tram street and is on a quieter side street but in close proximity to the Grand Bazaar and not a long walk at all down to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Cistern and other great sites in the Old City. The tram stops (either Beyazit or Laelli) are easy to get to. The hotel was comfortable and the staff was helpful and gracious. A highlight was the rooftop dining area for breakfast or dinner. Also for drinks (half price for Turkish wine or beer in May..) between 5 and 7 p.m. Great views out over the ever-busy sea of Marmara. The standard rooms are compact but certainly adequate, and if you are staying for several days or want a bit more space consider upgrading to a junior suite. Breakfast was excellent (included in the rate) with lots of Turkish cheeses, a good selection of breads, cereals, veggies, olives, yoghurts, and more. There was a small selection of hot breakfast items every day such as scrambled eggs or Turkish-style eggs with tomatoes and onions. Coffee was good. If you are looking for a moderately priced, central four star in the Old City I would definitely recommend the Antik Hotel.
reviews.title: Istanbul visit May 2012 - from Italy

reviews.text: We spent a week at the Antik hotel in July 2011 . We were 2 adult 2 children ( 13 and 16).
reviews.title: We highly recommend it-family from Canada

reviews.text: ROOM: We made reservation based on the pictures we saw on the net. We asked for the "red suite". I don,t know about the other room but if you ask for the "red suite" you won't be disapointed We travel very often and like confort and cleanliness. When got in the room, we were really surprised. The room was bigger and nicer than the pictures with 2 bathroom and 2 TV. Our bed was in separated part of the room than the children. (No ddor between ) It worth the price. Everything was bright new and and shiny: the linen, the wooden floor, the bathroom floor and walls... We could see ourselves through the white bathroom tiles.
reviews.title: Very affordable and good location for Sultanahmet

reviews.text: STAFF: Nice, with a smile and helpfull to give some tips and info.
reviews.title: Generally Positive Experience
didn t like
reviews.text: FOOD: Breakfeast was generous and excellent in a bright modern dining room. We had only 1 souper there. Very good, exellent service. But the place was empty. People prefer to go in the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AREA
reviews.title: Perfectly placed for local attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Antik Hotel. It was in a great location. We had a nice big room and the restaurant upstairs was a good option if you did not feel like going out. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends.
reviews.title: Excellent Location!

reviews.text: The hotel is situated in walking distantion from Hagia Sofia, Top Capi Palace and other Istanbul's highlights. Room was beautiful, spaceful and cleen. There were only three things we didn't like about hotel: 1) all hotel staaf (aspecially at front desk and in restaurant) were very slow and not nice. 2) poor breakfast fast same ever day. Coffe was really awful and artificial fruit juices weren't drinkable. 3) it was quite noisy at night in our room because of some works on street (started at 7 PM).
reviews.title: Great location, not such a great staaf

reviews.text: Very near to the main street for taxis and Tram, Grand Bazar was near by. No need of walking uphill compared to the other hotels in the vicinity. Break fast was just OK, Rooms were clean. The staff were very polite and spoke good Eglish, Wetayed for five nights, they could arrange for transport a few times and that was very helpful.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From 2006 we visited this hotel every year. This year we´re here for the 6th time. It is has good accomodation and location in the middle of Beyazit-Istanbul. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. For visiting the city - nearby the Grand Bazar and a tramway-stop and off course for shopping - It is s a very good location.
reviews.title: A friendly and well located hotel

reviews.text: We certainly come back again.
reviews.title: Stellar service for our small group

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is 2 1/2 to 3-stars. The rooms are typically European-style (quite small), ensuite bathroom (also very small). The rooms were clean. The decor is pleasant, but the walls are exceedingly thin. We could hear casual conversations and coughing from another room. We were there in April 2012; the weather was warm with cool nights, but the temperature in the room was very hot. Opening a window was insufficient to cool it down, and the hotel was unable to provide us with a fan. The beds are very hard, not at all comfortable - unless you like that sort of thing. Be sure to ask for a queen or king bed if you are a couple. We initially got two twin beds. The front desk moved us the next night to a room with a queen.
reviews.title: Good location, modestly priced hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is included in their fares and the meal is ample. The location is very close to the tram stop or a km+ walk to the main touristic attractions.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Nice hotel, confortable rooms but small bathrooms. Staff not very friendly at the reception. Good breakfast buffet but their staff didn't clean the tables between 2 different customers. I ordered airport transfer at their reception but in the morning they told me that I had to pay the driver in cash which I wanted to avoid. The driver asked me shorty before arriving at the airport to pay him as he might get in trouble with the police at the airport ?!?
reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN!!!!

reviews.text: Good location if you want to be close to the Grand Bazaar. 15 mn walk to Blue Mosque.
reviews.title: well run hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for four days and from the moment we walked in the nightmare began. First, we walked in and we were not greeted by anyone at all. We walked up to front desk to check in and the girl at the front desk ( Neriman was her name) and again she didn't greet, her first words to us were "passports". My husband handed her his passport and credit card and her response was, I didn't ask you for a credit card. Her tone was rude and condescending to say the least. When booking reservation, we indicated that we were arriving at noon and would need an early checkin. They had our reservation completely wrong, not only did they want us to wait two hours for room but they also didn't have the room we requested available. We had two rooms reserved, one for myself, my husband and two children (ages 2 and 4) and one room for my in-laws. The room that was intended for myself, husband and kids was the one not available and they wanted us to take a room with two single beds (twin size beds). The manager was very nonchalant and rude and basically said that is what is was and we could take it or leave it. My husband was furious and ended up having an arguement with front desk manager. After contacting our travel agency and hotel manager they apologized and immediately upgraded us to a suite. The room and hotel itself was nicely decorated and very cool for the historical aspects within the actual facility but the customer service was nonexistent. So with the check-in behind us, we get to the room which was spacious and clean however the room was so HOT! Apparently there is central heat and air but it is controlled by the front office and they were running the heat. The day we arrived it was 18 degrees celcius (about 64 farenheit) The thermometer in the hallway read 29 degrees celcius (84 farenheit) so I can only imagine what our actual room temperature was! When we asked if there was any way to just stop the heat, not even turn ac on just turn heat off and their response to us was "what if someone is cold"
reviews.title: Best ever place antic place at Antik Hotel

description: Located in the center of Istanbul, Antik Hotel is less than half a mile from the Grand Bazaar and Theodisius Cistern. Luxury amenities include a sauna and massage treatments.The history of Istanbul is the inspiration for this unique hotel. Built on top of a Roman cistern, each floor of the hotel is designed to represent 4 different periods of Istanbul's past.The contemporary rooms are equipped with flat-screen TVs, hardwood floors and white linens on the plush beds. A sitting area and a sea view are offered in some rooms.The staff at the front desk is available 24/7. Information about car rental can be found at the Antik’s tour desk.Marmarion Restaurant serves Turkish, Ottoman and international cuisine on the terrace, which offers charming views of Istanbul and the Marmara Sea.Hotel Rooms: 132
